title: Moving messages from webmail into thunderbird
content:
My Windows 10 desktop failed and went into a shop for repair. I have years of Thunderbird messages on it. The repair is complete and Thunderbird is working well again.

However, for several weeks I was only able to send and receive messages via my ISP Webmail. I would now like to move these messages into Thunderbird on my repaired desktop computer.

I cannot find an elegant way to do this. I know I send forward or resend all of these messages from Webmail to the main address on the desktop and then move them into the appropriate In or Out folders. But, I have downloaded all of these messages onto a flash drive and would like to use it to load the messages.

I would appreciate any advice about the best way to do this.

Thank you in advance.
creator: rob86a

title: Email download not working
content: "Get Messages" does not work. I am set up for auto giving every month, and you Donate Demand is preventing me getting my new nessages
creator: rlspalding

title: I have lost my Thunderbird account passwords
content:
I have just bought a new computer and have downloaded Thunderbird for my emails. I have 3 email accounts. I have lost my passwords for these accounts. When I look on my old computer in Thunderbird I go to password manager and there are no saved passwords for me to get. It's like I have to set up thunderbird all over again. I transferred from the old thunderbird to the new one and nothing happened. I AM A NOVICE AT THIS. No accounts etc etc no passwords. I am desperate. Yes I used an external drive to put the thunderbird stuff on the new computer,

PLEASE HELP
creator: jwagener76

title: Thunderbird and outlook login problems
content:
I'm having a problem between Thunderbird and Outlook that started in the last few weeks. I've been using T-Bird for decades. I have 5 e-mail accounts from various e-mail providers, all collected under t-bird, But recently the one account that connects to an outlook server has been generating password reject messages in bursts and then goes quiet, connecting regularly and pulling mail. I thought it might be from using obsolete domain names as microsoft has been pushing to get people on office365 domains. So I tried changing that one account to using an outlook.office365.com domain. That seemed to improve things for a few hours but actually not. The next day more of the same periodic bursts of password reject popups and than back to normalcy. So my questions are these:

1> What is the right set of server settings to achieve the same kind of generally error-free access to an e-mail address resolving to an outlook-based e-mail account (in this case an e-mail address at msn.com)? 2> How do you go about replacing the server settings in order to go thru discarding the old settings while preserving the e-mail filters you have uniquely assigned and reassigning them to the revised account settings? 3> I recall seeing some e-mail traffic from microsoft regarding their mucking around with their email domains but don't recall seeing anything recently that would indicate a recent significant change other than the push for office365 - which I don't use. Am I missing something that microsoft has done that should drive me to change this e-mail address to another e-mail server?
creator: axel43

title: when sending a message in Thunderbird, my sent folder always shows two messages sent, why is this and how can it be fixed?
content: when sending a message in Thunderbird, my sent folder always shows two messages sent, why is this and how can it be fixed? I have been through settings and cannot find any obvious setting that could be set to do or change this duplication in sending mail. Can you please advise? Bernibabe.
creator: bernibab

title: Mail Erişim Problemi
content:
Sn. İlgili,

Thunderbird aracılığı ile 3 ayrı mail için sizin değerli programınızı kullanıyoruz. Problemin çözümü noktasında sizden desteklerinizi rica ederiz. Mail gönderip alamıyoruz. Ekte gelen uyarı mesajını görebilirsiniz. Ayrıca sürekli olarak "' connection timed out uyarsı veriyor.
creator: serhat2

title: Potrjevanje (ne)udeležbe na sestankih oz. srečanjih
content:
Pozdravljeni

V službi dostikrat dobimo povabila na sestanke, ki pa jih v Thunderbirdu ne morem potrditi. V Outlooku so opcije, ki udeležbo potrdiš oz. zavrneš. Kaj moram namestiti, da lahko potrjujem sestanke v Thunderbirdu? Lightning vmesnik imam, pa mi ne pokaže nobene opcije potrjevanja, ampak samo povzetek povabila.
creator: mlakar.primoz

title: Why can't I see the SMTP settings?
content:
I'm probably wasting my time here because whenever I Google this problem I get instructions that do not work. And If I try and search Thunderbird Settings with the simple searchterm SMTP I get 'Sorry! There are no results in Options for "smtp".' This seems a peculiar error message for an application that purports to be an email client! And I've just updated to the latest version (115.7.0).

So, pretty please with sugar on top, how do I get to see the smtp server settings in Thunderbird? I would really hate to have to switch to Outlook.

Thank you

Matthew Fisher
creator: maf128

title: V doručené poště se nezobrazí emaily, které označím barevným štítkem.
content:
Dobrý den, už delší dobu mě TH trápí a zvažuji, že si budu po mnoha letech najít jiného poštovního klienta. Zaprvé dělá nevím proč to, že když začne načítat emaily, tak na čas zmizí ty stávající a tak jako zamrzne. Musím tedy počkat, až toto skončí, abych mohl pokračovat. A dnes jsem zjistil, že když označím email barevným štítkem, tak se mi tento email přestane v hlavní složce zobrazovat. Pomůže až restart. Toto ale dělá dost často. Nevíte prosím proč?

Děkuji

tisk@armenit.cz

title: For SSO Enabled account unable to Access Mail using Thunderbird
content:
For this SSO Email account to work it requires authorization from 3rd party Portal where we have to provide the credentials to finish authentication. When we are trying to Access Email [SSO] with Thunderbird It redirects to the Login page of Organization Which in turn it should open the New tab after clicking on User Portal here in the below attached Picture. I Have tried performing the IMAP, POP3 and also Manual Configurations to make this work But eventually getting the same issue on Blocking where Thunderbird is not allowing to redirect / navigate to New tab with Login page after clicking on user portal.

Please let me know how to reach to the new page or how will it show the second tab with login page details.

title: autenticação de dois fatores
content:
Olá, eu tinha duas contas gmail configuradas e funcionando tudo ok no thunderbird, e uma parou de funcionar, eu fiz varios testes para tentar autenticar novamente mas nenhum deu certo, removi a conta a tentei configurar novamente, ela chega na parte que abre um popup do google e pede permissão quando clico em permitir o thunderbird da um erro: "Não foi possível acessar a conta no servidor. A configuração, o nome de usuário ou a senha provavelmente estão errados."

Já desinstalei o programa e instalei tudo do zero e o erro continua, alguém já passou por isso?
creator: Maison

title: Moving a huge number of folders from Local Folders to IMAP email accont
content:
I am trying to help move an email account which was POP onto IMAP so they can have their emails on a couple of other devices other than their desktop. The issue is they have hundreds of folders in their local folders. I have setup their IMAP and have tried to copy over a few folders at a time onto the IMAP account, however I find that Thunderbird struggles with copying them and there are just so many that I can see myself getting in to trouble in a minute with duplicate folders in both locations.

I thought of a work around which appeared to work where I went into the Thunderbird profile for the user and copied the email folders from the local folders onto the newly created IMAP account. I then opened Thunderbird up in "Offline" mode and checked all the emails were there. They were which was great however as soon as I went online all the folders disappeared. I am guessing that this is the server overriding the local email client. How can I stop this happening and force the server to mirror what is showing on Thunderbird?
creator: chris.palmer

title: Two dashes above signature - inconsistently appearing
content:
A double dash line appears above my signature when composing a new email, but it does not appear when replying. This changed when I set my signature to appear below my reply rather than at the very bottom of the email - previously the dash line/separator appeared in all contexts. That's what I'd like to happen - I want the separator to appear every time, whether it's a reply or a new email. Is there any way to fix this?

Thanks!
creator: sfd85

title: impossibile accedere ad un singolo account gmail
content: Improvvisamente per uno dei miei account gmail è diventato impossibile accedere alle mail ed al calendario. Mi chiede continuamente di concedere le autorizzazioni a Thunderbird per gestire l'account di gmail ma anche se le concedo non risesce ad accedere (Errore di auenticazione). La password è giusta e l'ho anche cambiata per sicurezza. Cancellando l'account e ricreandolo mi chiede prima la password e le autorizzazioni ma poi si blocca sempre con errore di autenticazione (vedere screenshot allegato). Utilizzando un nuovo profilo di TB vuoto il risultato è lo stesso. Sullo stesso PC con altri client (Winmail, Outlook) tutto ok e anche con thunderbird da altri PC il funzionamento è regolare. Suggerimenti? grazie in anticipo.
creator: andrea.ballarati

title: Comcast IP address blacklisted
content:
New issue 2/10/24. TB (115.7.0) won't retrieve nor send emails thru Comcast. No settings or accts were changed. Went to an old restore point on Win 10, didn't help. Reset router, PC, uninstalled TB, reloaded TB, didn't help.

Reviewed past articles (most are old) tried some of those solutions, but no joy. Can't find an Xfinity (comcast) phone # to call their tech support, although I doubt if they're any help. Will blame it on TB no doubt.

Could really use some help here. Appreciate all you guys efforts!

title: Thunderbird kezelöfelület átméretezése, minimalizálása, hogy az E-Mail nagyob teret kapjon a képernyőn.
content:
Sziasztok.

Thunderbird beállításához kérek segítséget olyasvalakitől, aki érti a haladó beállításokat Pixel szinten a submenüben.

Mivel ide csak fényképet lehet feltölteni és videofájlt nem, a kérdés leírásom pedig sokkal hosszabb lenne betűben mint videóban, így a kérdésemre készített videót kénytelen voltam feltölteni egy weboldala. Az itteni linken lehet megtekinteni a kérdésemet. A videófájl amúgy Gmail barát (X.264 fájl MKV konténerben) 25MB alatt tartottam a nagyságát ha netán levélbe kellene továbbítani. Köszönöm mindazoknak akik segítenek.

https://www.mediafire.com/file/gje540hfd9y46fi/Thunderbird_vokoscreenNG-2024-02-01_13-11-59-01.mkv/file

A videó 14 napon belül törlődik kb Február 26.-án
creator: extravaganter

title: Passwords and Oauth2
content: How can I identify and or change the password associated with my email accounts once Oauth2 is invoked?
creator: KuchleiT

title: Moved from W10 to Linux (Rocky/RHEL 9) and spam filtering seems broken
content:
I understand the adaptive methodology (I've coded Naive Bayes algorithms) but since the move from a Windows 10 workstation to a Linux workstation (three months ago), I've been marking a LOT of spam emails. I'm wondering how much data the algorithm needs or if there's a setting I need to change. I'm also wondering if the feature works the same on Linux and whether I can migrate the fitted model that worked well from the W10 TB profile (?) to the Linux TB profile. Also, I'm wondering if there's any way to get insight in what state the model's in.

I'm sure I can find more info by digging around, but I was wondering if anyone had any comments or clues or was ever in a similar situation. If there's a problem with junk filtering on Linux, it makes TB a lot less useful.

-Alan
creator: alanmead

title: Mail Merge gives error "Unsupported Zip File"
content:
Hi,

I have got latest Thunderbird installed with Mail Merge Version 10.4.0 on a Mac. When I try to send a mailmerged email from a CSV (Used automatic or comma separated setting), it throws an error saying "Unsupported Zip file" and gives me links to the Home Page and the Change Log file.

When I accept the error message, it allows me to go into the final mail sending window. However, when clicked the "Start" button, no mail is sent.

Mail merge works without any issue on Windows PC. The issue is with the MAC.

Any help in getting this issue sorted is much appreciated.

title: how to send a libre office spreadsheet by Thunderbird email so that recipient can edit it and return it to me
content:
I need to send a Libre office calc spreadsheet to a colleague by email, so that she can enter input to it and have the formulas recalculate totals etc, and so that she can send it back to me.

I understood that if I log in via Thunderbird email, that this would be possible.

I have done a lot of experimenting but have not been successful. '

I am sure that both of us need to be using Thunderbird to do this, and until she is signed up to that, I am just mailing the spreadsheet to myself via thunderbird, I can open the document but cannot do any input on it, it comes up as 'read only'.

I went to Tools on Libre office page and added my email address, and on Edit, clicked send 'as an open document spreadsheet' is this correct please?

title: Thunderbird Email - Trash Count Not Updating
content:
I am running Thunderbird 115.7.0 (64-bit) for Mac.

I am using Unified Folders. When a unread message appears that I consider trash I press the delete button from my custom toolbar.

The message gets set to the unified Trash folder and it displays (1) because there is 1 unread message in the trash.

Then I click "File, Empty Trash". The trash folder still displays (1) - even though the trash folder was emptied. When I click on the unified trash folder - I can see the folder is empty and then the counter changes from (1) to blank.

I have set my Account Settings to synchronize all my trash folders every 1 minute but that doesnt seem to help. If I right click and mark all the messages READ, that doesnt correct the problem either.

Help please.
creator: chad37

title: No messages to Download, but messages are on server
content:

GMail however isn't recieving any new mail, it runs through the send recieve ok, and says there are no new messages to download, despite the fact there are about 40 emails a day hitting that account. I can get onto emails through my phone, or through the website. This started a couple of days ago, no settings have been changed. I can send from the Gmail account, so the sending is OK, just not the recieving. I've tried compacting folder, with no effect. I've run in troubleshoot mode, with no effect. Spam Folder is empty

title: Can I combine emails with different subjects?
content: I have a bunch of separate email threads regarding the same issue, but since different people have gotten involved over time they are sporting different subjects and therefore aren't all in the same place. Is a folder the only way to do it? It just seems to me that being able to drag them together as a single Inbox item isn't an unusual thought.
creator: artpringle4

title: Unable to send emails on Thunderbird, but am able to receive emails. ISP has checked and found no problem with their email system. Problem seems to be with outgoing SMPT settings.
content: I don't know how to get into the system to check the settings and if I were able, I wouldn't know what to do. I need some guidance in this area. I probably need someone to speak to me so, just in cast, my mobile is [phone# removed from public support forum]. In Australia. Thank you, in advance. Edward Gray
creator: edbev

title: 8 new problems with latest update
content:
Not sure where to put this; too many issues at the same time.

Initial post: https://forums.debian.net/viewtopic.php?p=792869#p792869

cat history.log-* history.log | grep -i firefox -B2 Start-Date: 2024-02-11 19:50:43 Commandline: /usr/bin/unattended-upgrade Upgrade: thunderbird-l10n-en-gb:amd64 (1:102.13.1-1~deb11u1, 1:115.7.0-1~deb11u1), thunderbird:amd64 (1:102.13.1-1~deb11u1, 1:115.7.0-1~deb11u1), thunderbird-l10n-fr:amd64 (1:102.13.1-1~deb11u1, 1:115.7.0-1~deb11u1)

- Thunderbird moved the top menu bar to the left, now has unreachable buttons at the bottom due to negative interactions with other menus and window manager => tried many forums, but all changes to ./chrome/userChrome.css are ignored. - the quick filter button was moved from the toolbar to an individual bar, adding one new line above message list, reducing the vertical space for content - new management of borders have negative interactions with window manager (tried both options, with and without decoration, both are ... BAD). making it impossible for window manager to properly resize window magnet to other windows - there are large sensibility zones for decoration management catched by TB that make some buttons unreachable in the left bar, and the window manager gadgets i have below (quick launch and desktop management) - there is a new sensibility zone between the top menu bar and the top decoration of windows that give access to some window manager menu, useless at this place, and it reduced the vertical sensibility zone of the buttons, making the click box smaller, and reducing the effective size of buttons, making them harder to click - the unread message count which used to be a nice light blue is now white in a dark grey box, catching the eye more than necessary, slowing me down, and increasing my brain work to focus on what i need to do. also this value is unconsistent; my inbox is curretly shown with 411 total messages, and 630 unread. If i unfold the folder in left column, it seems i have only 89 unread in inbox, and 2 in one subflder, but, to me, 89+2 is not equal to 630. - the file/edit/view menu bar is now BELOW the actions buttons Get/Write/Reply ... - if I roll up the TB windows in the top decoration, any mouse click in the place where the win used to be remains inefficient. So, TB completely broke E17. A shaded win still occupies the screen as if it's unshaded, and more (about 20 pixels below the bottom decoration). - It's 20y the message list was aligned on the top message, so I always made that box half a message taller than an exact message line height multiple, so that the half line white space was a proof I was at the bottom of the list. Now, the list is aligned bottom, and the top line is shown half. I now have no way to know if i am in middle on bottom of list (plus lift is now auto hide). 

i don't have any screenshot from previous version for reference. And half issues are bad interactions with E17 about magnetism, and size of click boxes, and this can't be shown on screenshots; even videos would not help if you can't feel it physically, or never used E17 yourself in the past; you can't know how it used to behave.

All these changes have an intense negative impact on my work speed. They slow me down.

TB had almost not changed in 20y of use, but these changes, at the same time, with so many consequences on window manager ... I can't stand it. 20y of habits lost in one evening. Not something you can change at my age.

I have seen only one improvement (bug fix) in recent TB: "save all" attachements works now fine from the menu under the message, and we no longer need to use Save All from top menus (regression bug between TB 1.2 and 1.5, IIRC).
creator: benoit12
